description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows Imaging Component remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-38060):

1. Download and apply the updates for your respective Windows version from the official Microsoft Update Catalog.
2. Ensure that the version of Windows matches one of the following:
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: KB5040442
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2: KB5040442
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2: KB5040431
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2: KB5040427
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2: KB5040448 or KB5040427
3. Restart your system after installation to finalize the updates.

**Details**:
- These updates address the critical security vulnerability associated with a heap-based buffer overflow, which could lead to remote code execution.
- For more information and installation packages, visit the following links:
   - [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
   - [KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431)
   - [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427)
   - [KB5040448](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040448)

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system is updated to the mentioned build versions.
- Backup important data before proceeding with the updates.
